CardName: I'd Just As Soon Kiss A Wookiee
Lore: "I can arrange that. You could USE a good kiss!"
Gametext: Use 3 Force to place an opponent's just deployed character, starship, vehicle, weapon, or device in opponent's hand. On opponent's next turn, that card (or one card of same title) may deploy for free.
Information: These unique Lost Interrupts (I'd Just As Soon Kiss A Wookiee and its counterpart It Can Wait) can be quite annoying, and somewhat helpful despite their low destiny numbers. They play if the opponent just deployed a card (except Immediate Effect), using 3 Force to return it to the opponent's hand.\par The Force they spent remains used, and on the next turn they must redeploy that card (if possible) for free using the same target(s). This is a great way to delay the opponent's strategy for a turn when they try to deploy a very powerful card. That alone can be worth stocking a destiny 2 card in your deck, as it gives you an extra turn to prepare for it. These cards are also great to use in an old-fashioned manipulation deck. Following up with a Grimtaash / Monnok (Used or Lost) or Recoil In Fear / Uncertain Is The Future can get rid of the "bounced" card for much longer than a single turn! If the bounced card was a character, Scanning Crew, M'iiyoom Onith, or Oola becomes even more effective!
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-9)\par (Errata) No matter where the targeted card is being deployed from (from hand, from Reserve Deck, from Bargaining Table etc.), that card is "bounced" to its owner's hand. The card that is "bounced" has been deployed (immediately before being bounced) for any triggers or automatic actions dependent upon that event. For example, an objective may flip when the character is deployed if dependent upon controlling or occupy. Similarly, if Daughter of Skywalker is being deployed from Reserve Deck (using Mind What You Have Learned), Leia will be targeted by that objective for remainder of game, even if subsequently "bounced". See Simultaneous Deployment, Ch. 5.
IsCanceledBy: Hear Me Baby, Hold Together (V11)\par Protector\par Restricted Access (V11)\par Who's Scruffy-Looking?

Lore: Passenger and cargo transport built by Gallofree Yards. Enormous cargo bays can be outfitted to safely accommodate large numbers of troops, munitions or supplies.
Gametext: Deploys and moves like a starfighter. May add 1 pilot, 4 passengers and 1 vehicle. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1.
Information: If you put this ship into a situation where it is unlikely to be battled (i.e. - the Clouds on Dagobah) it begins to shine. The most common way that the Dark Side has to overrun the Clouds on Dagobah, is to move a Star Destroyer loaded with TIE's over to the Dagobah system, have the TIE's move into the clouds, and start Tallon Rolli-ng all the starfighters that they can get their sights on. Because the Medium Transport is a capital starship that moves and deploys like a starfighter, it is immune to this silly tactic. It's power works out to be the same as a Y-wing (0), it suffers no penalties to it's Maneuver (it doesn't have one), it has a permanent pilot, and it's forfeit is one better! If you're opponent is using Bounty Hunter ships (like Slave 1), then deploy the Medium Transport to Kessel, put any pilot main character (except Chewbacca) aboard, and you have a destiny draw as well! Granted, it's not as powerful as Boba Fett in Slave 1, but with Yoda on the Dagobah: Yoda's Hut you'll be able to reduce the Attrition by 2, and your opponents power will be -2 for being in the Clouds.\par \par Because the Medium Transport can deploy and move like a starfighter, it can deploy to a Docking Bay, and land at exterior Sites. This has come in handy for me several times, when an emergency evacuation is called for on Tatooine, or when I want to deposit some characters on Dagobah, and have no Encampments or Great Warrior's handy. Finally, for a really big power boost, deploy a Cloud Car into the belly of the Medium Transport at Kessel, and move it to Dagobah, and then into the Clouds. Drop off a few Cloud Cars this way, and guaranteed your opponent wont be aching to initiate a battle there.
IsPulled: Admiral Ackbar (V14)
Combo: Medium Transport + Cloud Car (repeatedly) \par -----\par Medium Transport + R5-M2 + BoShek\par Power 5, Armor 3, immune to attrition < 3, immune to Tallon Roll, and a Battle Destiny draw\par -----\par Medium Transport + Evacuation Control\par Makes the Transport hyperspeed +2, immune to attrition < 3 and it may move for free.

Information: You can't deploy to the same site as the Probe Droid (he has no ability), but you can Force Drain with them, and with a forfeit of 5 they can look after themselves too. You can spread them out and send them Undercover, spread them out to Force drain or use them to ambush a lone character.\par \par The Probe Droid is the first and currently only non-unique spy in the Star Wars Customizable Card Game. While this can be a terrific advantage, the Probe Droid's deployment restriction makes it rather difficult for it to deploy in any deck except for a strict Star Destroyer deck. However, in that deck, the Probe Droid has little to no equal for ground defense. Being non-unique has tremendous advantages in that you never have to worry if there is another Probe Droid on the table. Plus, with Undercover, you could potentially have an Undercover Probe Droid at every site, aiding in the deploy of such powerhouses as Darth Vader and Boba Fett to a hard to reach location. With Cane Adiss, these Droids can even go to Dagobah, which can significantly help against a Dagobah Force drain deck.

IsPulled: Debris Zone (V4)\par Twi'lek Advisor\par Utinni! (V2)\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Lore: Cybot Galactica starship maintenance droid. Repairs over 5,000 different onboard systems. Used by Rebel Alliance salvage teams.
Gametext: While at an exterior planet site or docking bay, once per turn may lose 1 Force to place a 'hit' starship or vehicle at same site, adjacent site, related system or related cloud sector in Used Pile instead of Lost Pile.
IsPulled: Echo Base Garrison\par Scomp Link Access (V6)

Lore: Served for many years as a \b gunner\b0  with friend Jek Porkins in the Tierlon Yellow Aces. Expert marksmanship helped the Alliance earn some of its earliest victories.
Gametext: Adds 1 to weapon destiny draws of anything he is aboard as a passenger (adds 3 if aboard Rogue 3 or with Wedge or Jek).
Combo: Wes Janson + Nick Of Time (V4) \par Makes him add 2 to power of anything he pilots.

Lore: "I must've hit pretty close to the mark to get her all riled up like that, huh kid?"
Gametext: Cancel Scruffy-Looking Nerf Herder or I'd Just As Soon Kiss A Wookiee or Furry Fury or This Is Just Wrong or Death Mark or Mournful Roar or Takeel or Ket Maliss. OR Double Rennek's power for remainder of turn.
IsPulled: Chewbacca (V3)
Cancels: Death Mark\par Furry Fury\par I'd Just As Soon Kiss A Wookiee\par Ket Maliss\par Ket Maliss (V3)\par Mournful Roar\par Scruffy-Looking Nerf Herder\par Takeel\par This Is Just Wrong

Lore: Rebel \b spy\b0. Served undercover as a sensor specialist aboard the Star Destroyer \ul Avenger\ul0. Assigned to scan for Imperial ships through the meteor activity of the Hoth system.
Gametext: Once during each of your control phases, may peek at X cards randomly selected from opponent's hand, where X = number of (Dark Side Force icon) icons at same site. Also, when you are drawing destiny, adds 2 to the destiny of any card with 'scan' in the title.
Information: Cards with 'scan' in title are:\par \par Hyperwave Scan\par Hyperwave Scan (V3)\par Perimeter Scan
Combo: Wyron Serper + Double Agent

Lore: "Steady. Hey! Steady, girl. Hey, what's the matter? You smell something?"
Gametext: Target a creature vehicle at same site as a creature. If ferocity > target's maneuver + landspeed, creature vehicle is eaten, \b cumulatively\b0  adding 2 to creature's ferocity.
Information: First, deploy a Wampa, for free, to the Wampa cave. Then put a few Banthas outside (to answer the question I hear every time I do this, no Banthas do NOT deploy only to Tatooine!). During your move phase, the Wampa goes outside to find a few tasty morsels hanging around. Target the first one and draw destiny. As long as you draw a 1, the Bantha is eaten, (Wampa is ferocity 3 + destiny). After that you don't need to worry about missing a draw! Eat a few more, then set the Wampa loose against your opponent!\par \par Hoth offers the Dark Side some great Force drain and fighting locations. Once you have a 9 + destiny ferocity Wampa running loose, you'll find those AT-A's to be wonderful havens and your opponent will be wishing he had a snowspeeder or two to hide in! The Wampa attacks anything present at the same site, so the Light Side undercover spies won't stand a chance, and you can keep draining without hindrance! And if your opponent decides to stand and fight, you can thin his forces before a shot is fired (Remember, creature attacks occur at the beginning of EVERY battle phase). Even if an opponent's character survives a Wampa attack, that character can't participate in any battles that turn.
IsPulled: Tauntaun Skull

CardName: You Have Failed Me For The Last Time
Lore: "Lord Vader, the fleet has moved out of lightspeed and we're preparing to aah...ukh...uh...uuuuukkk!"
Gametext: If Vader is on table when opponent has just initiated a battle, target one opponent's leader of ability < 6 involved in that battle. If opponent does not win battle, target is forfeit = 0 and is lost (placed out of play if Ozzel).

CardName: You Will Go To The Dagobah System
Lore: "There you will learn from Yoda, the Jedi Master who instructed me."
Gametext: During your control phase, use 1 Force to move any one of your [Hoth] icon characters of ability > 1 to any [Dagobah] icon location where you have presence. If moving to a Dagobah site, this movement is free and you do not need presence.

Lore: Born on Kestic Station near the Bestine system. Daring pilot who can fly anything. Found Luke and Han in the Hoth wasteland. Piloted Rogue 2 at the Battle of Hoth.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Rogue 2, also adds 3 to maneuver and may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
Information: When Zev Senesca pilots Rogue 2, the maneuver of 7 makes it nearly impossible for the Dark Side to hit it with a weapon. But you can also put that maneuver to even better use with the Power Harpoon. After the Walker has crashed, finish it off with Duel Laser Cannons.\par -----\par Rogue Squadron is:\par \par Biggs, Rogue Legend (V)\par Commander Luke Skywalker\par Commander Luke Skywalker (V)\par Commander Narra (V)\par Commander Wedge Antilles\par Commander Wedge Antilles (V)\par Corran Horn\par Dash Rendar (V)\par Dack Ralter (V)\par Derek 'Hobbie' Klivian\par Derek 'Hobbie' Klivian (V)\par Karie Neth\par Keir Santage\par Kin Kian\par Luke Skywalker, Rebel Hero (V)\par Luke Skywalker, Strong In The Force (V)\par Ten Numb (V)\par Tycho Celchu\par Tycho Celchu (V)\par Veteran Rogue (V)\par Wedge Antilles, Legendary Rogue (V)\par Wedge Antilles, Red Squadron Leader\par Wes Janson, Rogue Veteran (V)\par Zev Senesca
IsPulled: Echo Base Garrison\par General Dodonna (V)
